questions.question: The paragraphs section lists key paragraphs but omits the file close paragraphs (e.g., 9100-TRNXFILE-CLOSE, 9200-XREFFILE-CLOSE, 9300-CUSTFILE-CLOSE, 9400-ACCTFILE-CLOSE performed at lines 331-337). These include error handling on closes. Should they be added for completeness?

What about documenting the initial TIOT/PSA processing loop at lines 266-291, which iterates over TIOT entries to display DD names and UCB status? Is this diagnostic or critical for batch execution context?

In BR002 and table description, you note 'up to 51 cards, 10 trans each', but the load loop at lines 818-850 increments CR-CNT/TR-CNT without bounds checks against OCCURS limits at lines 226/228. Are you sure there's no overflow risk?

In called_programs, CBSTM03B citation is only 351 (XREFFILE read), but calls occur extensively for opens/reads/closes, e.g., line 734 (TRNX open), 746 (first TRNX read), 860 (TRNX close). Does the single citation suffice?

In data_flow reads_from TRNXFILE, fields include TRNX-DESC (citation 677), but table stores TRNX-REST at line 829 and moves it to TRNX-REST at 427 before using TRNX-DESC. Is TRNX-DESC part of TRNX-REST or a separate field in the copybook?
